summary: Rachel Zegler is a rising star in the entertainment world, catapulted to fame as Maria in Steven Spielberg's 2021 adaptation of "West Side Story." Her casting, at just 17 years old, marked a significant step for Latinx representation in Hollywood. Beyond her vocal talent and acting prowess showcased in "West Side Story," Zegler has quickly become a sought-after performer. She starred as Anthea in "Shazam! Fury of the Gods" and landed the coveted role of Snow White in Disney's upcoming live-action remake. Zegler's journey is not without its controversies, including online backlash to her casting and comments, but she continues to navigate the industry with resilience. Her diverse roles and undeniable talent solidify her as a prominent figure to watch in the years to come, impacting representation and pushing boundaries in musical theatre and film.
